choiceOption.name: pdb_sc_prescaler
choiceOption.toolTip: The PDB clock = Bus Clock/(Prescaler * Divider)

choiceOption.name: pdb_sc_mult
choiceOption.toolTip: The PDB clock = Bus Clock/(Prescaler * Divider)

choiceOption.name: pdb_sc_trgsel
choiceOption.toolTip: Selects the trigger input source for the PDB.\n The trigger input source can be internal or external (EXTRG pin),\n or the software trigger

choice.name: FTM0 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
FTM1 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs (if present)
FTM2 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs (if present)
FTM3 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs (if present)

binaryOption.name: pdb_sc_dmaen
binaryOption.toolTip: When DMA is enabled, the PDBIF flag generates a DMA request instead of an interrupt.

binaryOption.name: pdb_sc_cont
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit enables the PDB operation in continuous mode with the pdb_cnt counter rolling over at the pdb_mod

binaryOption.name: pdb_sc_pdbie
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit enables the interrupt.\n When this bit is set and DMAEN is cleared, PDBIF generates a interrupt.

binaryOption.name: pdb_sc_pdbeie
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit enables the sequence error interrupt\n When this bit is set, any of the channel sequence error flags generates a sequence error interrupt.

choiceOption.name: pdb_sc_ldmod
choiceOption.toolTip: Selects when to load the MOD, IDLY, CHnDLYm, INTx, and POyDLY registers,\n after 1 is written to LDOK

choice.name: Loaded when the PDB counter reaches MOD
Loaded when a trigger input event is detected
Loaded when either the PDB counter reaches the MOD or a trigger input event is detected

intOption.name: pdb_mod
intOption.toolTip: Specifies the period of the main PDB counter\n When the counter reaches this value, it will be reset back to zero.\n If the PDB is in Continuous mode, the count begins anew

intOption.name: pdb_idly
intOption.toolTip: Specifies the delay value to schedule the PDB interrupt.\n It can be used to schedule an independent interrupt at some point in the PDB cycle.

bitmaskOption.name: pdb_ch0_c1_en
bitmaskOption.toolTip: These bits enable the ADC pre-trigger outputs\n Each pre-trigger corresponds to a conversion in the ADC as specified by SC1[n]

bitmaskOption.name: pdb_ch0_c1_tos
bitmaskOption.toolTip: These bits enable the ADC pre-trigger delay\n If disabled, the pre-trigger asserts 1-clock-cycle after trigger\n If enabled, the pre-trigger is further delayed until the count reaches the channel delay register value

intOption.name: pdb_ch0_dly0
intOption.toolTip: Specifies the delay value for the channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

intOption.name: pdb_ch0_dly1
intOption.toolTip: Specifies the delay value for the channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

bitmaskOption.name: pdb_ch0_c1_bb
bitmaskOption.toolTip:
These bits enable the ADC pre-trigger operation as back-to-back mode.
 Back-to-back operation enables the ADC conversions complete to trigger the next PDB channel
 pre-trigger and trigger output, so that the ADC conversions can be triggered on next set
 of configuration and results registers. Application code must only enable the back-to-back
 operation of the pre-triggers at the leading of the back-to-back connection chain.

binaryOption.name: pdb_int0c_toe
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit enables the DAC interval trigger.

binaryOption.name: pdb_int0c_ext
binaryOption.toolTip: Enables the external trigger for DAC interval counter.

intOption.name: pdb_int0_int
intOption.toolTip: Specifies the interval value for DAC interval trigger.\n DAC interval trigger triggers DAC update when the DAC interval counter is equal to the DACINT.
